thread.title: Indio boys win second DVL race of the season
thread.title_full: Indio boys win second DVL race of the season

title: Indio boys win second DVL race of the season
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Indio boys win second DVL race of the season With another individual race win from Luis Barrera, the Indio boys' cross country team defeated Xavier Prep and the rest of the DVL Wednesday. Post to Facebook Indio boys win second DVL race of the season With another individual race win from Luis Barrera, the Indio boys' cross country team defeated Xavier Prep and the rest of the DVL Wednesday. Check out this story on desertsun.com: http://desert.sn/1RJkiaJ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation Nathan Brown, The Desert Sun 10:02 p.m. PDT October 14, 2015 Xavier Prep hosted the DVL cross country meet on October 14, 2015. La Quinta won in the girls division while Indio High School won in the boys. (Photo: J. Omar Ornelas/The Desert Sun) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Despite some minor shuffling and Cathedral City’s Andrew Nevarez improving four spots to second place, Wednesday’s second Desert Valley League boys cross country race of the season resulted in a near clone of the race that occurred three weeks ago. 
And that’s just the way the Indio Rajahs like it. 
Placing six runners in the top 16 and three in the top six, the Rajahs did their best to back up their previous team victory and move one step closer to a team league title after Xavier Prep broke Indio’s nine-year title streak a year ago. 
Junior Luis Barrera certainly did his part, taking first for the second time this season with a nearly identical winning time, crossing the line in 15:31. Nevarez followed in 15:48, along with Xavier Prep’s David Stabile (15:52), Indio’s Mario Salazar (15:58) and Xavier Prep’s Alex Rose (16:05). 
After spending most of the first DVL race jostling for position with Xavier Prep’s David Stabile, Barrera said he felt much more comfortable in the top spot Wednesday. Consequently, he wasn’t really challenged much after the first few minutes. 
“I felt more relaxed, actually,” he said. “The last race, I collapsed afterwards because I was so tired, but this race I finished really happy.” 
Indio coach Santiago Briones came into Wednesday’s race a bit uncertain of where his boys would finish after taking first handily three weeks ago. In a race both Xavier Prep and the Rajahs ran at Stanford just days after the first DVL race, Briones said the Saints edged out the Rajahs in total racing time between the two squads, proving the Saints certainly shouldn’t be considered out of the DVL race. 
“We knew we had our hands full coming into today ... We knew Xavier Prep was going to come out guns blazing,” Briones said. “I was very pleased with how they performed today.” 
Briones said that this season he’s experienced some trial and error as a coach, trying to figure out the best training regimen for a varsity group that contains freshmen and seniors alike, but it appears things are finally falling into place. 
“We have such a diverse group of kids when it comes to age,” Briones said. “Some are more mature than others physically, so it’s been about trying to find the right amount of recovery and the right workload to keep them healthy and keep their mindset where it needs to be.” 
And Wednesday’s performance showed him his boys have no plan of giving up that top spot in the DVL anytime soon. 
“We’ve progressed a lot compared to the last DVL race ... I feel really confident in my team going on,” Barrera said. “Now it’s our turn to start a new streak, and I’m proud to be a part of that.” 
Individual results 
1. Luis Barrera (I): 15:31 
2. Andrew Nevarez (CC): 15:48 
3. David Stabile (XP): 15:52 
4. Mario Salazar (I): 15:58 
5. Alexander Rose (XP): 16:05 
6. Johny Diaz-Reyes (I): 16:11 
7. Adrian Felix (CV): 16:16 
8. Ivan Esquivel (LQ): 16:33 
9. Robert Martinez (CV): 16:36 
10. Alfredo Gonzalez (PS): 16:39 
11. Gabriel Rodriguez (XP): 16:42 
12. Brendan Carretero (LQ): 16:48 
13. Jose Quintero (CV): 16:49 
14. Jullian Dorantes-Lara (I): 16:49 
15. Erick Dominguez (I): 16:53 
16. Andres Mejia (I): 16:56 
17. Braulio Ramirez (XP): 16:57 
18. Kevin Hernandez (CC): 17:01 
19. Hazrin Peraza (CC): 17:02 
20. Ethan Gomez (XP): 17:04
